attributes.action: Prorogue parliament so that brexit can be delivered.
attributes.additional_details:
Parliament has rejected a deal 3 times and are also trying to stop a no deal, however they voted overwhelmingly to trigger A50 on 29th March 2017, which gave us 2 years to negotiate a deal. Parliament voted against a deal, against alternative options and will carry on doing so. 

PM Johnson should go the the Queen and ask for a prorogation of parliament until brexit is delivered. The government are committed to leaving the EU by 31st Oct and this is the only way they are able to.
attributes.background: Boris Johnson has not ruled out proroguing parliament so that we can leave the EU on the 31st October. The Government want to deliver brexit by the 31st OCT  and want to respect the will of the people.
